channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Russia has agreed to talks with Ukrainian leadership, saying it was willing to send a delegation to the Belarusian capital. Follow our live coverage. https://t.co/NQ3OJB2zoD

Chinese leader Xi Jinping told Russian President Vladimir Putin in a phone call that he supported Russia and Ukraine resolving their differences through talks, saying that Beijing would decide its stance on Ukraine based on the merits of the issue https://t.co/GTuVZ4nHPX
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is causing the last thing the world needs—another "supply shock" similar to those that have haunted the global economy throughout the pandemic https://t.co/j06abtf9le
Kyiv was rocked by explosions as Russian forces renewed their bombing of Ukraine and pushed closer to the capital https://t.co/ObAiO8B6fi

Shortages of oil, gas and other commodities triggered by Russia’s invasion of Ukraine will likely exacerbate inflation as central banks are trying to tame it #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/uHkzYrSaAx https://t.co/UvcV4y3NQu

In the past two months, Jared Kushner has toured Persian Gulf monarchies with a pitch for his new $3 billion fund: Get a piece of deals made possible by Trump administration diplomatic initiatives https://t.co/srvx1yMaVo
The UEFA Champions League Final has been relocated to the Stade de France, near Paris, following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Follow latest updates https://t.co/Xi7yZL5MP1

“The continued expansion of NATO is a serious threat against the stability and security of independent countries in various regions of the world," Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi told Vladimir Putin in a phone call, according to Iranian state media https://t.co/Y1RmsRLc89
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/EbExj6pjTm https://t.co/liMU9MB7Kb
European countries on the border with Russia or Ukraine put troops on high alert and are rapidly expanding their militaries https://t.co/G0JWctwlwU
Why is Russia invading Ukraine and what does Vladimir Putin want? https://t.co/lvM37uxkVE
Russia’s military push deeper into Ukraine is one of those rare events that will change the world in unknown ways, writes @GeraldFSeib https://t.co/0B3Exq8eLx
China said it respects the sovereignty and territorial integrity of all nations but added that it could see “complicated and specific” historical questions at play in Ukraine https://t.co/g3H8PcpR9z
Follow the latest developments of Russia's invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/NYfdQ3yiG5
Telecommunications operators in Ukraine are in some cases being overwhelmed or out of service in parts of the country as the Russian attack continues https://t.co/ZGu0evycfJ
What is Swift and why is it being debated as a sanction option for Russia? Here's what we know. https://t.co/DIKkoeWROf
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/0AEAvV0M2z https://t.co/pAUZMYVfwN
These charts and maps explain the latest on the Russian invasion of Ukraine—and how it got to this https://t.co/FqKQKaffWT

The Biden administration has said that while disconnecting Russia from Swift isn’t something it planned to push, that option is still in its arsenal of possible moves. EU officials have described it as a last-resort measure. https://t.co/YNGpITeHxz
Russia’s assault on Ukraine triggered calls for Western allies to disconnect Russia from the so-called Swift global payment system. Here's what that means: https://t.co/hsVSkJBsza

“Horrific Russian rocket strikes on Kyiv. Last time our capital experienced anything like this was in 1941 when it was attacked by Nazi Germany,” Ukraine’s Minister of Foreign Affairs tweeted. “Ukraine defeated that evil and will defeat this one.” https://t.co/yzXyC0uqJ9
Kyiv Mayor Vitali Klitschko announced that three people had been injured, one of them critically, when a rocket fragment hit a residential building in the city early Friday https://t.co/ShA6dGXTN8

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is President Vladimir Putin's boldest move yet in his long campaign to reassert his country’s status and redeem the humiliation of the Soviet Union’s fall https://t.co/TYXp78UwOT
Russian forces renewed bombing and targeted Kyiv early Friday after Putin ordered an offensive aimed at toppling Ukraine’s government https://t.co/wzhFWyQqil
The EU will formally sign off on sanctions Friday that will cut 70% of Russia’s banking system off from international financial markets https://t.co/jV31nocIGs
Roughly 100,000 Ukrainians have been displaced, according to estimates from the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees https://t.co/t2n4rHTZv5
Russia’s attack on Ukraine pushed oil prices into triple-digit territory for the first time since 2014 https://t.co/x864EI0ecY

From @WSJopinion: A political fix for November won’t repair the damage progressives have done to the U.S., writes @DanHenninger. The Democrats deserve to lose. They’ve earned it. https://t.co/f5qWkak3qE
These charts and maps explain the latest on the Russian invasion of Ukraine—and how it got to this https://t.co/2JhPW8lqJN
Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelensky, said his country had sustained 137 dead and 316 injured on Thursday, as Russian forces broadened their offensive https://t.co/3a7B0WzCjF

From @WSJopinion: If Americans want to know why they should care about Ukraine, nuclear proliferation is one reason. Betrayal has consequences, as the world seems destined to learn again the hard way. https://t.co/MQXhdjOT3Y
NATO members bordering Ukraine and Russia are buying advanced weapons and building up their forces in response to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/mNJbENLgEm
Russia’s assault on Ukraine triggered calls for Western allies to disconnect Russia from the so-called Swift global payment system. Here's what that means: https://t.co/9IYtltoxEZ

Russia’s overnight assault on Ukraine triggered a surge of calls Thursday for Western allies to completely cut Russia off from the global financial system, but fear of collateral damage is quashing the idea for now https://t.co/HVeoiruK0R
Stocks recovered from a sharp selloff after the U.S. expanded Russian sanctions. Nasdaq rallied more than 3% as the Dow gained 90 points. https://t.co/NIarcwKRZR

Russia’s invasion of Ukraine is President Vladimir Putin's boldest move yet in his long campaign to reassert his country’s status and redeem the humiliation of the Soviet Union’s fall https://t.co/0WxZihYY3m
What does Russia’s invasion of Ukraine mean for the U.S. and Europe? Executive Washington Editor @GeraldFSeib joins Moscow Bureau Chief @AMSimmons1 to discuss https://t.co/YYDIbfZtjW

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau unveiled additional sanctions against Russia on Thursday that he said would target dozens of individuals and entities, including financial elites and major Russian banks https://t.co/lUAeHCUKLY

Breaking: Three former Minneapolis police officers were found guilty by a federal jury of violating George Floyd’s civil rights, in a case that launched a national discussion over race and policing https://t.co/FcDSZj7ay7

Hundreds of Ukrainians poured across a border post on Poland’s edge on Thursday, dragging suitcases and bearing looks of disbelief. “I woke up when I heard explosions, and I didn’t think anything. I just ran,” said one refugee. https://t.co/hdauQ6s6bw
Microsoft has built one of the world’s biggest private cyber armies to counter cyberattacks, but the storm of threats is expanding https://t.co/5wzsMiOP00
A U.S.-based nonprofit that helped Americans and others escape from Afghanistan last year said it had launched an evacuation operation in Ukraine https://t.co/JqwglCpOZq

“I can’t believe this is happening in the 21st century. It’s a nightmare.” Civilians across Ukraine scurried for cover as Russia's large-scale military offensive began with air and missile strikes overnight. https://t.co/dfrqENAmpV

Ukrainian officials said Russia had attacked on a wide front along the country’s frontiers. By nightfall, Russian forces captured the now-defunct Chernobyl nuclear power station. https://t.co/wvwXpm3Qwy
Breaking: The SEC is investigating whether stock sales by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his brother Kimbal violated insider trading rules, people familiar with the matter say https://t.co/B6HqWCJ1cJ
President Biden said the U.S. will impose new sanctions on Russian banks and elites, ramping up efforts to punish Moscow for the invasion of Ukraine https://t.co/llZj3lT5ye

Russia’s attack on Ukraine has investors worried about "stagflation," higher inflation, weaker growth and a tough task for central banks, as @WSJheard explains #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/rh746DuVtu https://t.co/u20OQsNQqj

Russians took to the streets to protest their country’s invasion of Ukraine, defying an ongoing crackdown on political opposition. More than 850 people had been detained as of Thursday evening, according to a protest monitor. https://t.co/xoAoxCIy3K

President Biden will deliver a speech detailing what White House officials describe as harsh economic penalties on Russia as his administration ramps up efforts to punish Moscow for invading Ukraine https://t.co/vNhEoTvB1S

The Russian military’s invasion of Ukraine began from three main points, opening a multipronged operation that includes a thrust toward Kyiv to remove the Ukrainian government leadership, U.S. defense officials said https://t.co/qdlxVPEWcn
